critique: This document is an executive order transferring jurisdiction over land from the Federal Works Agency to the Navy Department during World War II. It seems primarily concerned with logistical and administrative matters related to the war effort. There's no indication of ideological bias, immigration policy, or social inclusion. It does expand executive power to some extent, but this is explicitly tied to the declared emergency. It also shifts control from one federal agency to another, indicating a slight increase in federal control. Given the context of wartime, the focus is on national security.
